Sometimes I think about having just one cigarette to calm my nerves. Is it really that harmful if I only smoke occasionally? Maybe it's okay to indulge once in a while, right?

Working in a high-pressure kitchen, smoking feels like the only way to stay sane. It's my moment of peace in the chaos. I know my wife wants me to quit, and I've tried, but I become a nightmare to work with – all stressed out and snapping at my staff. Maybe I can just smoke at work and not at home? That way, I can keep my cool in the kitchen without disappointing my family too much. It's a compromise, right?
